poem:
Title: "In the Cactus Shadows"

In the dry heart's canyon, the gavel's beat echoes;
Freedom's flower unfurls, catching justice's sunrise.
Laws from the dust of yesteryears are muted, lassoed
by progress's horse, charging the limitless skies.
The bell of choices tolls within the desert's sigh,
Phoenix's rebirth, in the arid womb, lies. 
A stay, a pause - ninety days in delay's goodbye.
